Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with incurved sides, a central cone and a short pointed nozzle. The underside is turned and burnished, with a small central concavity. Many pieces are missing. The nozzle has a black glaze. Red-brown fabric with common mica and fine white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Similar form from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 21A, no. 156), parallels from Tocra and South Ionia (Bailey 1975, 1989-9). Bailey suggests this may have been made in Naukratis (Bailey 1975, 198), however an East Greece origin seems more likely. Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals, Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q464)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.22) (Phase 1)
